By James Clay

Nouse sits down with nightclub photographer and University of York student Felix Wahlberg.

YUSU celebrates and recognises the voluntary work of students across York

By James Clay

Student volunteers acknowledged during Student Volunteering Week 2023

Local Plan for York under consideration

By James Clay

Plans for future investment in housing and infrastructure are being debated by the local council

UCU strikes stood down

By Gracie Daw

Action on 21, 22, 23, 27, 28 February and 1 and 2 March will not go ahead

YUSU Election Results 2023

By James Clay

Pierrick Roger re-elected as YUSU President

By Gracie Daw

YUSU Election Results 2023

By James Clay

Pierrick Roger re-elected as YUSU President

People & Planet: "The chicken came first. And it still does!"

People & Planet members have been protesting against the sale of caged hens' eggs on campus (Thumbnail credit Left to right: Phoebe Cullingworth, Krzysiek Garstka and Luke Capps campaign for only free-range eggs in Costcutters)

York student injured in road traffic incident

A University of York student was today hospitalised after being hit by a taxi on University Road

Departments to suffer PS1.2m hit

University departments at York have been told to find an additional PS1.2 million in savings for the academic year 2010-2011, following huge governmental budget cuts in higher education funding announced before Christmas (Thumbnail credit SAM NEWSOME)

"No Chinese or similar" says YRLA

The letting agency APYork has been accused of racism and sexism following advertisements placed on their website (Thumbnail credit SAM NEWSOME)

Course Rep elections need to be "refined"

YUSU efforts to standardise course representative elections have been undermined as departments across the University have failed to implement a consistent policy

P.O.R.N.O posters accused of sending out the wrong message for the second-year running

This year's Vanbrugh College P.O.R.N.O poster has once again become the target of YUSU criticism as, recent complaints emerged denouncing the artwork as offensive to both women and religious groups (Thumbnail credit JUSTYN HARDCASTLE)

Heslington East to provide financial respite in face of cuts

The University's Heslington East expansion will offset a certain proportion of the Higher Education funding cuts expected to hit York next year, University chiefs have stated (Thumbnail credit GEORGE LOWTHER)

Criticism levelled against University over current lack of standardised mitigating circumstances policy

A standardised 'mitigating circumstances' policy is to be introduced at the University following criticism of the lack of coherent guidelines for those who were unable to return to the University after heavy snowfall at the beginning of term (Thumbnail credit GEORGE LOWTHER)

Rally to be organised against ultra vires laws

YUSU are set to be pressurised by the United Nations Association (UNA) so that societies can work around the current ultra vires charity laws, which restrict society fundraising

Langwith to move to Heslington East

The University has this week confirmed rumours that Langwith College will be moving to the new Heslington East campus

NUS criticises funding rules for part-time students

The NUS has called for a review of current government policy regarding part-time student funding, following the release of a damning report by the million+ group of universities

Cultural Exchange

Laura Connor investigates the advantages of taking time out to study abroad

Catering facilities to be built in Hes East

Plans are in their final stages for a new catering facility to be opened on the Heslington East campus

'We are Golden' soon to commence

YUSU are preparing for their upcoming Employability Week, 'We are Golden'

YUSU to launch 10:10 initiative

YUSU are to promote awareness of the nationwide 10:10 initiative after the University has still not agreed to sign up to cut 10% of their carbon emissions during 2010

Body found in Ouse identified as missing University of York Student

A body recovered from the River Ouse on January 4th has today been confirmed as that of missing 21-year-old University of York student, Pierre Le Moignan

Derwent accommodation to become catered

Derwent College accommodation is to become the first fully catered accommodation on campus at the start of next academic year

Students expected to return for exams regardless of dangerous weather

University of York students have been told that they are expected to do all they can to return to University next week for exams, regardless of the dangerous weather conditions (Thumbnail credit Steve Unwin)

York lecturer knighted

A University of York lecturer, Professor John Stranger Holman, has been given a knighthood in the recent New Year's honours list

The One Show features University of York researchers

BBC One's weekday magazine programme <em>The One Show</em> has recently featured the developments and ideas of researchers at the University of York's Centre for Usable Home Technology (CUHTec)

University of York graduate dies in accident

A University of York graduate, Ruth Holdway, 29, has died in a holiday accident whilst exploring a tunnel in Madeira

Search for missing Chemistry student centres on River Ouse

The search for missing University of York student Pierre Le Moignan has entered its third week as North Yorkshire Police admit that the investigation is focused on the River Ouse

York students caught up in bitter rivalry between ex-YRLA partners

University of York students have been thrown into confusion following the breakdown of the on-campus letting agency Yorkshire Residential Letting Agents

Financially suspect Heslington contractors go into administration

Work on parts of the University Heslington East expansion were put on hold last week after the contractors, UCS Civils Ltd, went into administration

Racial Equality Officers "must be black"

YUSU has come under fire after failing to address the ambiguous self-definition of racial background requirements for Racial Equality Officers, outlined in their constitution

YUSU Disability Committee proposed

The creation of a YUSU Disabilities Committee was one of the motions discussed at last Thursday's UGM. If passed, the new committee's roles will be to "promote Disability campaigns" and to "represent the Disabilities movement on campus"

Student death on A64 sparks road safety talks

The death of a Univeristy of York third-year History of Art student, after a car accident on the A64 last Sunday, has reignited concern as to the road's safety

Fusion 2010 theme is announced early

Fusion has announced its theme for 2010 as 'Twisted Fairytales'. Scheduled for the 5-6 March in Week Eight of Spring Term, Fusion promises to combine the creative force of the 20 committee members with music, dance and fashion

Courtyard to be heavily affected by January exams

The Langwith JCR section of The Courtyard will not be available for food and drink consumption for over half of Week One in the Spring Term

University rent-banding to create greater financial segregation between students

Students have this week voiced outrage after YUSU revealed University plans to introduce rent-bands to distinguish between different qualities of accommodation on campus

People & Planet: "The chicken came first. And it still does!"

People & Planet members have been protesting against the sale of caged hens' eggs on campus (Thumbnail credit Left to right: Phoebe Cullingworth, Krzysiek Garstka and Luke Capps campaign for only free-range eggs in Costcutters)
